They're in the big blind with position on me. With a stack of 860 vs their 1110, I want to pick my spots carefully.

Looking at effective stack sizes (860 effective), calling the single 20-chip raise is reasonable here. I do have some backdoor equity with this hand, and a King kicker can be valuable. I'm out of position but the odds are good.

[Call]

rounds.response:
I flop bottom pair with a 6-4 rainbow one-gutter to a straight that is never good here. The board contains three Broadway cards (9-T-J range) that hit pre-flop ranges hard, and I have no back-door flush draw. I’m behind almost everything—any overpair, any overcard, any two-pair—and the pot is still small. My stack depth (~26 bb effective) favors tighter play multiway, and with four players left this is a clear fold to preserve equity.

[Fold]
